title: Which writer’s work has most often been made into films? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you had to guess which living author not named Stephen King has the most film adaptations, you’d be forgiven for guessing J.K. Rowling or John Grisham. That’s what I did! They’re close, but as of today, Nicholas Sparks is the reigning champ with 11 movies. His run started in 1999 with the maudlin “Message in a Bottle” and in terms of box office and critical acceptance, peaked five years later with “The Notebook.” His books have niche appeal, but that niche might be narrowing: The three lowest grossing Sparks adaptations are the most recent. Here’s a list of his books that have been made into movies: Message in a bottleA walk to rememberThe notebookNights in RodantheDear JohnThe last songThe lucky oneSafe havenThe best of meThe longest rideThe choice

By far Stephen King with over 30 of his works transported into movies or TV series… Carrie Salem's lot Shining Christine The running man Silver bullet The Shawshank redemption Apt pupil The body The stand It Creepshow I and II The Tommyknockers Dreamcatcher The dark half 22/11/63 Precious things Dolores Claiborne The Cat's Eye Cujo Christine Children of the corn Pets sematary The Firestarter The Dead Zone The Dark Tower The Green Mile Misery Evil Eye The mist The dome… And probably many others that i forgot to mention…
